This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ASSESSINGACCESSION.

The conference aims at exploring the potential of Renewable Energy Sources in the Danube Region (towards the transition into the post-carbon and post-nuclear era). 20 Feb 2015<br><br>Full details here: http://www.canterbury.ac.uk/migration-research-phd<br>Please share this message with anyone who may be interested.<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Laura<br><br>Dr Laura Cashman<br>Senior Lecturer in Politics and International Relations<br>School of Psychology, Politics and Psychology<br>Canterbury Christ Church University<br>North Holmes Road<br>Canterbury<br>CT1 1QU<br>Tel: 01227 767700 [...] Tom Hashimoto 2015-01-16T22:24:13+00:00 2015-01-16T22:24:13+00:00 CfP: The Political-Economy of Place-Based Policies with a Focus on Special Economic Zones https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASSESSINGACCESSION;58da5401.1501 CfP:\ufffd\ufffdThe Political-Economy of Place-Based Policies with a Focus on Special Economic Zones(Apologies for cross-posting)<br>April 23-24, 2015 --\ufffd\ufffdWarsaw, Poland(http://www.case-research.eu/en/node/58709)<br>The conference organisers (Dr. Camilla Jensen of Southern Denmark, Dr. Christopher Hartwell of CASE, Katarzyna Sidlo of CASE and Tom Hashimoto of Oxford) cordially invites submission for a conference on the "Political-Economy of Place-Based Policies" with a focus on special economic zones.\ufffd\ufffd<br>TopicsWe welcome all manner of submissions regarding these issues, including but not limited to:\ufffd\ufffd<br>- SEZs and socio-economic goals at the regional and national level;- Evaluation of zones policies in terms of a particular approach to cluster building, examples [...] Koen Slootmaeckers 2015-01-10T15:54:13+00:00 2015-01-10T15:54:13+00:00 Conference: EU Enlargement, Democracy, and the Politics of Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity. Brussels, 4-5 February 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASSESSINGACCESSION;f4886ee8.1501 Dear All,<br><br>On 4 and 5 February the University of Leuven, Queen Mary University of<br>London, the European Parliament and the Belgian Science Academy<br>organize the conference "EU Enlargement, Democracy, and the Politics<br>of Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity".<br><br>On 4/02 the conference takes place in the European Parliament with<br>among others Tanja Fajon, Tanya L; Domi, Philip Ayoub and LGBT<br>activists from the SEE region as speakers. On the second day, the<br>conference takes place in the Belgian Academy for Social Sciences<br>(located near the EP). The registration page can be found on [...] Michael Jetton 2015-01-08T15:27:01+00:00 2015-01-08T15:27:01+00:00 Re-integration Grants for Western-trained Economics PhDs in CEE/fSU countries https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASSESSINGACCESSION;8e318a15.1501 CERGE-EI in Prague, Czech Republic invites applications for its Career Integration Fellowship (CIF), part of its larger Teaching Fellows program which seeks to increase the quality of economics education throughout Central and Eastern Europe and the countries of the former Soviet Union (CEE/fSU).<br><br>The CIF program provides support of USD 7200 per year for three years for Western European, North American and Australia / New Zealand-trained Economics PhD graduates who accept full-time academic appointments at universities in CEE/fSU. [...] Eamonn Butler 2014-12-23T13:09:58+00:00 2014-12-23T13:09:58+00:00 A New Working Paper https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASSESSINGACCESSION;722ed140.1412 Dear all,<br><br>Please find attached a new working paper from network member Csaba Weiner from the Hungarian Academy of Sciences.<br><br>I would also like to take this opportunity to wish all our members a merry Christmas and happy new year.<br><br>K\ufffd\ufffdlm\ufffd\ufffdn Kalotay, Andrea \ufffd\ufffdltet\ufffd\ufffd, Magdolna Sass and Csaba Weiner: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRussian Capital in the Visegr\ufffd\ufffdd Countries\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, Working Paper, No. 210, Institute of World Economics, Centre for Economic and Regional Studies, Hungarian Academy of Sciences, Budapest, December 2014, http://www.vki.hu/files/download_711.html [...] Eamonn Butler 2014-12-12T12:48:28+00:00 2014-12-12T12:48:28+00:00 Call for papers: 7th Annual CRCEES Research Forum https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASSESSINGACCESSION;5011d2ad.1412 Call for Papers<br>7th Annual CRCEES Research Forum<br>Thursday 4 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Friday 5 June 2015<br>University of Glasgow<br><br>www.glasgow.ac.uk/socialpolitical/crcees<http://www.glasgow.ac.uk/socialpolitical/crcees><br><br>On Thursday 4 and Friday 5 June 2015 the University of Glasgow will host the 7th Annual CRCEES Research Forum.<br><br>The Research Forum is calling for proposals for individual papers or panels, plenary sessions, and workshops. We welcome contributions from postgraduate students; these may either take the form of papers integrated within panels or discreet post-graduate events. Proposals from those outside the CRCEES network are also welcome. [...] Anna Soulsby 2014-12-11T18:32:38+00:00 2014-12-11T18:32:38+00:00 Call for Papers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASSESSINGACCESSION;2cde28ae.1412 Call for Papers: Special Issue European Journal of Industrial Relations<br><br>Work and Organization in the Age of Global Economic Crisis:<br>Industrial Relations in the Post-Socialist Societies of Europe<br><br>Guest Co-editors: Anna Soulsby, Graham Hollinshead, Thomas Steger<br><br>In this special issue, we invite comparative studies that examine growing insecurities in the fields of work, organization and employment in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE), including the effects of migration, in the context of the international \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcrisis of capitalism\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. We are interested in research that investigates local responses (at the levels of the workplace, establishment or industry) to the spread of uncontrolled market [...] Eamonn Butler 2014-12-08T11:53:25+00:00 2014-12-08T11:53:25+00:00 Cfp. workshop on Europe and the New Global Agenda on International Development at Scope Conference, Romania May 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASSESSINGACCESSION;deffd6dc.1412 Sent on behalf of Dr Simon Lightfoot (University of Leeds)<br><br>Cfp. workshop on Europe and the New Global Agenda on International Development at Scope Conference, Romania May 2015<br><br>In 2015, the European Union marks for the first time in its history the European Year of Development. This brings it to the forefront of international efforts aimed at evaluating and (re)formulating a new global agenda on international development following the expiration of the deadline set for the fulfilment of the Millennium Development Goals generated through the ambitious project adopted in 2000 by the UN member states under the umbrella of the [...] Eamonn Butler 2014-11-26T19:00:34+00:00 2014-11-26T19:00:34+00:00 PhD Scholarship Opportunities in Russian, Central & East European Studies The University of Glasgow https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASSESSINGACCESSION;62853045.1411 Dear Assessing Accession members,<br><br>I would like to draw your attention to a number of postgraduate masters and PhD scholarship opportunities at the University of Glasgow. Please pass this information on to anyone who may be interested.<br><br>PhD Scholarship Opportunities in<br>Russian, Central & East European Studies<br><br>The University of Glasgow<br><br>The School of Social and Political Science, Central and East European Studies subject area at The University of Glasgow encourages applications for a range of PhD studentships (beginning September 2015) focusing on Russia, Central and East Europe or Eurasia. These studentships are offered on a self-funding and funded basis. Hartwell (CASE), Tom Hashimoto (University of Oxford) Contact: Tom Hashimoto (tomoyuki.hashimoto@linacre.ox.ac.uk) CALL FOR PAPERS [Apologies for cross-posting] The role of place-based policies for regional development While locale has always played a central role in any economic enquiry within an economic development and growth context, the absence of its political-economy aspects from [...] Eamonn Butler 2014-09-30T17:03:45+00:00 2014-09-30T17:03:45+00:00 CFP: PG Conference Contemporary Hungarian Studies, U o Glasgow 12-13/2/15 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASSESSINGACCESSION;82c8e537.1409 Forwarding for Information. Apologies for any cross posting.<br><br>CFP: Contemporary Hungarian Studies Postgraduate Conference: Multidisciplinary European Perspectives<br>12-13 February 2015<br>University of Glasgow<br><br>Hungary is a dynamic political and cultural space that has been in constant transformation since 1989, and where political developments since 2010 in particular have attracted considerable international attention. Although the country's current political trajectory has already invited a great deal of commentary from within as well as beyond its borders, further critical analysis is still required. At the same time, Hungary's social and cultural present also deserves further scrutiny by the international scholarly community. [...] Eamonn Butler 2014-09-30T16:57:44+00:00 2014-09-30T16:57:44+00:00 Call for Papers - Mainz 2015 Graduate Conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASSESSINGACCESSION;2196daaa.1409 Forwarding for Information. Apologies for any cross posting.<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS: GRADUATE CONFERENCE - THE EU IN THE WORLD<br>Proposals are now being accepted for papers to be presented at the "EU in the World" Graduate Conference, which will be held at the University of Mainz on 9-10 January 2015. London based with frequent travel in the UK and overseas. Salary band \ufffd\ufffd43,967 to \ufffd\ufffd68,539.<br><br>This is a critical role for the FCO and we are looking to raise the profile of the recruitment campaign; with this in mind if you have anyone in your professional network you think may be interested this role, we would be grateful if you would let us know or pass this communication on.
